results.title: More 'new' handwriting
results.creator_credit: Jeff Spencer, Diane O'Connor and Materials Production, Curriculum Branch, Ed Dept of Vic
results.brief_description: This is a sequel to”The New handwriting” which is part of a compilation tape entitled “Learning handwriting” It provides practical advice on such issues as the use of speed loops, alternative letter shapings and embellished handwriting. Also looks at teacher reactions to the change in style.

results.title: Morality: the process of moral development (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Roy Anthony Cox, Marcus Krigbaum, Eclipse Films (US) and Davidson Films
results.brief_description: Dr Susan Merrsemen-Warren and Dr Elliot Turiel interview and test children from the age of four until early adulthood in order to examine their concepts of sharing, fairness, justice, and other attitudes linked to the process of moral development.

results.title: Moral judgement and reasoning (TEFC)
results.brief_description: Examines various concepts of moral development as postulated by Freud, Piaget and Kohlberg and points out that moral knowledge comes to a child from many sources, including parents, older siblings and playmates.

results.title: Moral development (TEFC)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Developmental psychology today”.
Examines two opposing theories of moral development, that of Lawrence Kohlberg who believes that there are stages of moral development tied to cognitive development, and that of the learning theorists who contend that moral behaviour like all behaviour is learned, and that reasons for actions are irrelevant. Using Dr Stanley Milgrim’s famous obedience experiment each of the six stages of moral reasoning is represented in this film, one at a time, by six different participants. The stages differ in the types of reasons a person gives for making a decision about a moral dilemma and in the type of concern the person shows for the self, society, and authority.

group_works.title: Cheating
group_works.creator_credit: Graham Parker, Moreland-Latchford Productions and Oxford Films (U.S.)

results.title: Mopokes in action
results.brief_description: A scout training film showing the patrol system at work. The activities of a patrol, “The Mopokes”, including a weekly patrol meeting, a patrol outing and a patrol camp. The broadening of the patrol leader’s outlook is shown by his trip to a jamboree and his ability to help his patrol by virtue of having gained his 1st Class badge. How the patrol system offers the Scoutmaster the opportunity of developing leadership in boys.

results.title: Mooti: child of New India
results.creator_credit: J. Michael Hagopian and Atlantis Productions
results.brief_description: The story of a Hindu village boy who plays a part in a changing India. Through Mooti’s eyes are presented the three major concepts of the film: change to new tools, change to new industries, change to new relationships.

results.title: Moorditji: Australian indigenous cultural expressions (PC & MAC) (A)
results.creator_credit: The Moorditji Consortium, Australian Indigenous Cultural Expressions and Moorditji Consortium
results.brief_description: SYSTEM REQUIREMENTS: Windows 95, 98 or 3.1/Mac OS 7.1 or higher. Featuring Aaron Pedersen and Justine Saunders as your guides, this CD Rom showcases the work of more than 100 of Australia’s Indigenous artists. Learn about different artists and aspects of Indigenous culture Australia wide by exploring this well presented and highly informative CD Rom. A tip: This CD Rom contains visual, audio and textual information about many Indigenous artists, some of whom are deceased. If you think these details may be distressing and you would like to hide this information about certain artists, choose the “List of Artists” options in the opening menu. A teacher’s guide accompanies the disc and covers the following areas: introduction; using Moorditji; links with curriculum framework; teaching strategies and terminology, planning a unit of work; general worksheets.

results.title: Moonwalk
results.creator_credit: Theo Kamecke, Peretz Johnnes, Dean Gitter Productions and Learning Corporation of America
results.brief_description: A record of the journey that culminated in man’s first step on the moon, covering the spectacular blastoff, the lunar landing and the return to earth. Effective use of music, sound effects and slow motion. Includes images taken from inside the lunar module.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Theo Kamecke, Peretz Johnnes, Dean Gitter Productions and Learning Corporation of America

results.title: Moonstruck
results.creator_credit: Norman Jewison, Patrick Palmer and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.brief_description: A delightful romantic comedy which warms the heart. Cher plays Loretta Castorini, widowed at a young age due to “bad luck”. Engaged to timid Johnny Cammareri (Danny Aiello), Loretta attempts to mend the estrangement between Johnny and his brother Ronny. Instead, she falls in love with Ronny (Nicholas Cage). “Moonstruck” takes us into the hearts and minds of a loving Brooklyn-Italian family, sharing their dramas, tragedies and joys. “La bella Luna”, the moon, forms a romantic backdrop for the turbulent affairs of the heart and creates an atmosphere where anything can happen, and does! Co-starring Vincent Gardenia and Olympia Dukakis.
